Enum determining which coordinate to histogram.
Abstract container type.

Remove outliers from a straight line, where level in units of sigma. Level needs to be larger than one obviously.

briefdescription.para: Add a point to the data set.

parameterdescription.para: The error in the x value
The error in the y value

memberdef.name: gmx_stats_add_points

briefdescription.para: Add a series of datapoints at once. The arrays dx and dy may be NULL in that case zero uncertainties will be assumed.

parameterdescription.para: The error in the x value
The error in the y value

memberdef.argsstring: (gmx_stats_t stats, real *x, real *y, real *dx, real *dy, real level)
memberdef.name: gmx_stats_get_point

briefdescription.para: Delivers data points from the statistics.

detaileddescription.para:
Should be used in a while loop. Variables for either pointer may be NULL, in which case the routine can be used as an expensive point counter. Return the data points one by one. Return estatsOK while there are more points, and returns estatsNOPOINTS when the last point has been returned. If level > 0 then the outliers outside level*sigma are reported only.
stats
The data structure
x
The array of x values
y
The array of y values
dx
The error in the x value
dy
The error in the y value
level
sigma level (see above)
error code

memberdef.name: gmx_stats_get_ab

briefdescription.para: Fit the data to y = ax + b, possibly weighted, if uncertainties have been input. da and db may be NULL.

Pointers may be null, in which case no assignment will be done.

memberdef.argsstring: (gmx_stats_t stats, real binwidth, int *nbins, int ehisto, int normalized, real **x, real **y)
memberdef.name: gmx_stats_make_histogram

briefdescription.para: Make a histogram of the data present.

detaileddescription.para:
Uses either binwidth to determine the number of bins, or nbins to determine the binwidth, therefore one of these should be zero, but not the other. If *nbins = 0 the number of bins will be returned in this variable. ehisto should be one of ehistoX or ehistoY. If normalized not equal to zero, the integral of the histogram will be normalized to one. The output is in two arrays, *x and *y, to which you should pass a pointer. Memory for the arrays will be allocated as needed. Function returns one of the estats codes.
stats
The data structure
binwidth
For the histogram
nbins
Number of bins
ehisto
Type (see enum above)
normalized
see above
x
see above
y
see above
error code

briefdescription.para: Return message belonging to error code.
